name: Deborah pellem
text: Joshua is very personable, he does extremely good work. Reasonable prices and he is a great concrete guy. The company puts out beautiful work. Five 🌟

name: Kerry Jordan
text: I decided to add a decorative concrete floor to my sunroom. It was a small interior job and many concrete businesses in town didn't even bother to respond to my estimate requests. Josh, the owner of Old Towne Custom Concrete, responded quickly and gave me an reasonable estimate for the job. In just a few days, I had my new floor (within budget) and it looks great!

name: Michael Johnson
text: Josh did an amazing job updating our old, cracked deck.  He was extremely professional and got the job completed in a timely manner.  I appreciated his advice and guidance when choosing the color and pattern for our patio.  His pricing was competitive and reasonable, and we had a very good overall experience with this company.

name: Andrea Layden
text: Josh helped us expand our patio from the basic covered slab to a beautiful finished space on which we are putting a huge pergola. He was so easy to work with, brought my crazy vision to life, and did an amazing job! Very professional and communicative throughout the whole process. I'd definitely work with him again.

resp.text: Andrea thank you very much for the kind words. I hope you both enjoy it for many years.

name: Lisa Vickery
text: Josh and his team did a great job for our driveway and sidewalk. He stayed in constant contact throughout the process and kept us posted at every turn. The work itself was perfect and looks great. Did I say that he kept us posted all the way through? He communicated! Highly recommend.

resp.text:
Lisa,
Thank you for you're kind words.
It was a pleasure doing business with you and your husband.
If you ever need anything, please don't hesitate to call.
Joshua Scritchfield
Old Towne Custom Concrete

name: Heidi Jones
text: Josh and Team built a beautiful Kidney Shaped Concrete stamped patio. It's absolutely gorgeous and better then we could have ever imagined. Josh and his team were responsive and did everything to get the job done and on time. Thank and look forward to working with them again.

name: Keith Grisco
text: This guy is rude as can be, was ok at first .We saw his sign on the side of the road and gave him a cal. He missed first appt.  he finally went and looked where we wanted a fence and then gave me a price. After a couple days I called him to start the process, tell him I wanted to go ahead then he started with the BS. Saying he didn’t know if he had the material, wasn’t sure if he could get it. Said it would be 2-3 weeks which was fine because I didn’t need the fence up until then. He said he needed to meet with us to go over this and that and I said well my wife is in town for just a few days and gave him her number. He said he’d call. She didn’t hear from him so I texted him, he said he’d call. Almost a week later he called. My wife said that was last week, we aren’t in town now. Then he got rude as hell again.

name: Matthew Tucker
text: Company rep was extremely rude on the phone, like I was entirely wasting his time inquiring about material costs. Zero customer relationship skills and I won’t ever consider this guy again.

name: Faith Hope
text: I had a great experience with this company.  I recently moved to the area and was searching for a fence company to replace my fence and gate.  Someone recommended Swearingen so I gave them a call.  They gave me a fair quote and did an excellent job. They were very professional and were out on time and the work was done on schedule.   I have more fence work that will be needed in the future and will be calling them again! Great people quality work and fair price.  Thanks Swearingen Fence and Deck!! I'm very happy with the work you did.

name: Don Harris
text: They just replaced a large portion of our  driveway and sidewalk. They removed the cracked sections, hauled off the debris and replaced the concrete in one day. All the workers were GREAT! They were very polite and even engaged my grandchildren who were watching. Everyone knew what they were doing. Rarely do products or services meet expectations and never do they exceed them. In this case they exceeded ALL my expectations. I would highly recommend this company should you need any remodeling, fence or driveway work. It was a pleasure to do business with them.

name: Bill Lewis
text: Very professional and we have used them for years at different houses I feel very comfortable recommending them to anyone they are the best

name: Austin Taylor
text: I was flexible on appointment time and contractor arrived late for a time he set. I wanted him to quote a deck build and privacy fence. I was looking for options on building the deck and he was visibly frustrated that I just didn't have a set design for him to quote. As an engineer and a business owner I understood that, but thats often part of the process. Then he mentioned he would reuse the existing rotted ledger board on the house. I kept my mouth shut but I was definitely on guard after he said that. Next I wanted him to quote a wooden privacy fence around a pool. We came to an area that required a metal section of fence across my driveway.  He told me it wasn't an option to use anchor bolts on concrete for the posts.  As someone he has a fair amount of experience about anchoring I flat out told him it was if he did it correctly.  Once again he got very irate. Then he told me it would take $7000 to cover the 60' section of driveway.  I pointed out that the metal section across the driveway is the same width as the 20' wide pool I wanted to fence off - it does not require anywhere near 60' of fence to go across a 2-car wide driveway. He got mad again when I told him this - but, I mean it's just so obvious.  He stormed off, saying he and I weren't going to get along and I could find someone else. A frustrating waste of time and certainly did not inspire confidence in me that this contractor was competent. He may in fact be competent, but with people skills like that you might never know for sure. I rarely write reviews but in this case I would definitely exercise great caution if engaging this person in any improvement project.

name: Christopher Smith
text: From the moment I first called for an estimate to continued follow-up, Swearingen Fence has been AMAZING!  Mr Swearingen, the owner, took all the phone calls, and followed-up personally.  When things altered even slightly, he called or texted instantly to keep us up to date.  He and his team have were extremely professional, courteous, and timely.  The work is GORGEOUS.  His fees were very reasonable, and he was honest about everything without us ever feeling pressured about the different products.  Even when our HOA audibled and wanted us to put another gate on, he and his team easily made it happen without concern.  I cannot recommend this company enough!

name: Warren Carr
text: Their attention to detail and making sure everything is right with customers is unsurpassed. Beautiful craftsmanship!

name: Anthony Bowers
text: Once on the yard in and out. Follow processor and no problem.

name: TommyCM72
text: Had a negative attitude. How are you supposed to know we're here? I'd suggest looking out the window.

name: Billy Thomason
text: Got in and out in no time flat.q

name: R Mack
text: Never have a hard time getting loaded here

name: Jonathan Martin
text: Took no time getting loaded

name: David Marler
text: this place is great enough just on pricing .but its so great to go to a place and they show there belief in the lord by there actions and the way they treat others. my metal for my house was so unreliable cheap but they treated me like I was a very important customer .I was amazed. and will never shop anywhere else or recommend

name: Sonya Buchanan
text: Undecided on what color metal I wanted for my new roof, Zack offered to mail me a samples to help me decide. Fast shipping and great customer service helping me decide and pay over the phone. I appreciate the kindness and respectful tone he presented to a undecided first time homeowner. Thank you Zack!

name: Debora McCutcheon
text: Do not do business with the guys!!! They take your money and don’t finish the job!!! We’ve been waiting over a year now. And they will not respond to phone calls.  Terrible customer service!!

resp.text: Deborah, My name is Zac Smith and I am the owner of Agcor. Please call me at the office on Monday. I have never heard of you before but I will be glad to see what the issue is. My personal email address is zsmith@agcorsteel.com. I am sure I can get to the bottom of it in a few minutes.

name: Innovative Fence Solutions Cullman, AL
text: Great place to deal with. Best prices around and good customer service.

name: Tim Chambers
text: Great working environment and great benefits.

name: Robert allan
text: It’s sad to see an Company that shows favoritism as well as neglect To OSHA rules as well they Have machines that Leak oil no lights on them no safety guards an well say your the on safe one here

name: Evan Brock
text: Great place to do business. Owners are great people and they'll get you what you need.

name: Kevin Gaskin
text: Great group of people, easy going to get unloaded

name: shawn hudson
text: First time customer, shorted one sheet called and told them I would be there the next day to pick up.  Was told it would be ready by Zack, the owner.  Got there the next day and material was not ready, waited 30 minutes to get it cut.  Climb up on the roof to finish my job only to find the sheet is 3 inches too long.  Not the best experience.   The quality of the metal was good, service, Not so much.

name: James Glimpse
text: outstanding products. Agcor Steel produces top grade steel buildings. We are working to build a shop with living quarters. A dream come true.

name: Dean Mangum
text: They built a pole barn for me. They did everything they said they would...and more. Good folks to deal with.

name: Vinemont Welding
text: Great people and great pricing

name: Dike Moss
text: Best place in Cullman to get metal roofing and complete pole barn kits.   Price and quality are tops here.

name: tamelia dixon
text: Can’t never get in touch with the company

name: Brandy Hand
text: Great place

name: Jessica Gibson
text: Do not waste your time or money. Professional up front. Quick estimate that turned into a drawn out month and a half for a slab to be poured for a 30x35 metal building. Drug the whole process out until pouring the concrete, which they rushed. There were holes, it was flaky and rough, when we asked for smooth, and then took 2 days to do patchwork, resulting in more flaking like a powdery floor I can poke my finger through. As soon as this was done, the owner called saying he was in a bind and that he knew it looked bad, but it was structurally sound and he needed his money. He went on to say that he would be unable to complete the ramps and the driveway repair that was initially agreed upon and in the estimate. He never calls unless you call first and sweetly lies about the progress and timeline. Worst experience every and will try and keep anyone else from going through the same thing if possible.

name: Del Chick
text: Jessica is absolutely right, he promises a good job, just about guarantees it verbally.    After waiting nine months For someone to come back and repair the imperfections in the concrete job they did on our patio, we were able to negotiate a different type of compensation.   Sometimes with contractors that’s what you have to do, it’s too bad, but that’s part of working with contractors.

name: Melissa Grodi
text: Ken Nummy and his crew were very professional and they did an amazing job replacing 2 large retaining walls and pouring a driveway on our property. The price was very reasonable and, since they were already on thevproperty, the crew helped my husband do all sorts of odds and ends at no additioal charge. I highly recommend K.C. Nummy.

name: Rodney White
text: Just really good people,,and great work..

name: Sullivan Edwards (Sully)
text:
Abraham and his crew were professional, courteous, and performed everything that I expected, while keeping me informed if anything unexpected came up.

They fixed some major drainage and erosion issues in the back yard (see before and after photos) by burying downspouts, building a French drain that went out to the road, and tying the downspouts into the drain. It is super satisfying to watch tons of water just pouring out of the drain into the street after a heavy rain.

They also graded and re-sodded the yard with Zoysia for less than it would have cost me to personally buy the Zoysia and lay the sod myself. I highly recommend Legacy for your personal landscaping project.

resp.text: Mr. Edwards,  We would like to take the opportunity to thank you so very much for the positive review.  Abraham enjoyed working on your drainage project and we are truly blessed to have such great people working with us to help solve issues that our customers may be having.  Have a great summer!

name: Rene' Holt
text: I never like to leave bad reviews and always try to keep them positive, but I contacted this company to help with some backyard design and remodel. I had a meeting scheduled with Jacob this past Wednesday and when he was 30 minutes late, I called the office to make sure nothing was wrong. Jacob called back and offered no apology for being a no-show but we rescheduled for today. It's a hour last our appointment time and he didn't show up again with no call and didn't answer his phone. If you can't be professional enough to keep scheduled appointments, twice, you're not a company I want to work with.

resp.text: Rene', thank you so very much for letting us know about the appointment issues.  This rarely happens, let alone 2 times.  Jacob inadvertently kept the same time from last week's appointment on his calendar and received a notice this morning that you cancelled the appointment, assuming it was this afternoon.  We regret that we were not able to be of assistance with your backyard project and appreciate again the review so that we can strive to do better, even in such a crazy year!    Tami

name: Neva Turner
text:
Our experience with Legacy truly deserves 10 stars. From first contact they have been the best company we have ever worked with. Everything was done timely and professionally. Quality is top notch. They have shown quality of work ethic beyond measure. We highly recommend this company. During this difficult time with Covid 19, working with everyone at Legacy has been inspiring and uplifting.
Great company !!

resp.text: Neva, getting to know you and your husband has been one of the highlights of our year.  You are such a pleasure to work for and your appreciation and kindness have not gone unnoticed.  The crew always enjoys working with you on your projects and we look forward to seeing what else you may have in store for your beautiful home!

name: Heather Meacham
text: Paul and Tami are so great to work with.  They pay attention to every detail and our patio is just perfect.  Very professional!!!

resp.text: Heather, it was such a pleasure to work with you on your patio project.  I absolutely love the color of the concrete,  it was an excellent choice.  Thank you again and enjoy your new patio!

name: Jason Comfort
text:
First let me say that my wife and I are extremely pleased with the work.  More importantly, Abraham and his crew were phenomenal.  They were cognizant of the fact that my neighbors and I are all working from home and kept the noise at a minimum.  They went out of their way not to leave a mess after the first day after asking what our HOA restrictions were.  When they were finished, they had filled in the large hole my dogs had dug and placed down a few pieces of sod to cover some bare spots.  Truly outstanding service.

Lastly, when they were finished, and before they left, your team saw one of my neighbors struggling to unload a trailer.  They offered to help unload the heavy item for him.  They were truly great ambassadors for the company.

We have some pretty grand plans for our back yard that will stretch over the next couple of years.  After this experience, I guarantee that we will be reaching back out to Legacy Outdoor Services.

resp.text: Jason, Thank you ever so much for the review!  Your patience as we worked on your project was very much appreciated as the wet weather  makes drainage work even more challenging.  We are very blessed to have great teams working with us and we can't wait to see what else you have in store for your home.  Have a great summer@

name: debi frankowski
text:
We are so pleased with the work that Legacy Outdoor Services just completed at our house.  They installed and sculpted the most beautiful waterfall feature in our mountainside back yard, along with up-lighting that really looks awesome in the evening.  Additionally, they put in a flagstone patio with a gas fire pit, with beautiful natural landscape features and mulch beds all around.  We have had many compliments on it, and it is surprisingly low maintenance too!  We just love it!
We had several unforeseen complications which were out of Legacy's control, related to our gas line installation and inspection,  that Legacy patiently and proactively worked through.  We appreciated their high level of customer service and commitment, and will certainly use them again in the future!

resp.text: Debi, We absolutely loved working with you both!  You have such a nice home and we were so happy to be able to help you design an outdoor living area that accented your already existing hillside.  You have been so very patient as we worked towards getting your gas issue resolved.  Now you can sit back and enjoy all the elements together that make for a very relaxing getaway!

name: Jacquelyn Pletcher
text:
Make sure your quote is EXTREMELY detailed, and that you’re home and watching every step they take for quotes involving construction. Otherwise you’ll end up with new concrete that is uneven (that will forever pool water TOWARDS your home), concrete paint that is already permanently stained with mud BEFORE they leave/finish, deep tracks in your sod because they will drive a concrete truck in your backyard, ground/grass that isn’t graded back the way it was before construction and therefore leaving extremely uneven muddy hills all over your yard, nails and cigarettes in your yard WEEKS after they leave, and a final structure that is uneven, sealed poorly, with paint drips that have dried.

Would not refer.

resp.text: Jacquelyn,  We just wanted to thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to leave us a review.  It is always important for a business to strive to grow in their professionalism and communication skills.  That growth is hindered if someone does not express their concerns that arise during and after a project.  Thank you again!

name: Aurora Marmolejo
text: I had some pavers placed around my back screen porch and a flower bedding put in front of my home. They did awesome work always done within two days and they cleaned the area really good. I highly recommend Legacy outdoor services.

resp.text:
Aurora, Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review!  The crews commented on how very kind you were to them while they were working and that means a lot.  We are excited for you to be able to use your new space and look forward to helping you in the future!
Tami

name: Susan Tuck
text: We hired Legacy Outdoor Services for a drainage issue.  We quoted several other companies as well.  Not only did Legacy provide a detailed quote with the scope of work to be performed it was very priced very competitively.  The entire staff is to be commended.  I was kept informed as to when the job would be started without having to follow up.  When the crew arrived they were well prepared and ready to work.  This is by far the best crew I have seen.  They worked extremely well as a team.  This was a messy job to say the least.  The clean up was amazing.  When they left you couldn’t even tell they had been there!  I would highly recommend Legacy for your outdoor needs.

resp.text: Susan, thank you ever so much for the positive feedback.  We appreciate greatly the opportunity to help you with your drainage issues and we are glad that we were able to meet your expectations!

name: Madeline Ortiz
text: Great experience, really pleased with the result Good communication and work complete on time. Definitely will do business again. Highly recommend this business

resp.text: Madeline,  thank you so very much for the positive review.  It was such a pleasure to meet with you and to design a landscape you can enjoy for many years to come!

name: Diane Cooper
text: Legacy Outdoor helped me get a couple of trees planted in my bare back yard.  They look nice and the hummingbirds are already checking the Japanese Maple out.  Tammy and I worked together to find the perfect trees, exactly what I wanted.

resp.text: Diane, you have been so great to work with over the past several years.  We appreciate the opportunity to help you with new projects and look forward to many more in the future.  Thanks again!

name: J M
text: My yard is really uneven in places after having new sod laid and the length of time for them to get my project done is what gives them three stars. Otherwise, they did a good job.

resp.text: Your feedback is greatly appreciated!  This year has been rather frustrating as covid, weather, and supply issues have caused delays that we have not had to deal with in the past.  Nonetheless, we are grateful for your patience and we wish you a safe and healthy rest of the year.

name: JB Robins
text: Legacy Outdoor Services did a most beautiful job landscaping my front yard.  They installed a stone border around my flower beds and perfectly matched the stone with the stone on my house.  They added so much color to my yard with yellow, red and green shrubs and added even more color with flowers.  It is outstanding and I am extremely pleased.  The landscape workers are very professional and polite.  They were always on time and did what they promised each day.  The owner, Tami, came by most days to ensure that I was happy with the way the job was going.  They are very flexible and allowed me to do add-ons as we progressed.  I plan to re-landscape the back yard next and I will be using Legacy.  Their work is excellent!!!!

resp.text: Ms. Jan, thank you so very much for the great review!  We very much enjoyed helping you with your landscape project and we can't wait to see what new ideas you will have for us in the future!

name: Patrick Miller
text: We are very happy with the work that was done. Owners and workers were extremely professional and courteous. Work was done on time and within budget. We can highly recommend this company.

resp.text: Patrick,  it was such a wonderful experience to work with you and your wife on this project.  To be able to add more outdoor area for you to enjoy while adding a functional walkway was our goal.  It was rather hot and your attention to our crew was appreciated.  Again, thank you for your review.

name: Joy Fitzpatrick
text: Loved working with Legacy on my landscaping and hardscaping.  They have a lot of creative ideas and deliver as promised. Their employees were respectful and pleasant to work with. I'll be contacting them again when I install a pergola and some additional projects.

resp.text: Joy,  Thank you so much for the encouraging review!  You had such great ideas that were not like most cookie cutter landscapes you might see.  It was so much fun finding unique plants and I have to admit there are more "tropical" options for this area than I thought.  You are great to work with and I hope that we have the opportunity to help you again in the future.

name: Carol Johnson
text:
We chose Legacy Outdoor Services to implement the first phase of a multi-year landscape plan for our new house. It was an excellent experience all around and we are very, very pleased with the results. Everyone there is a pleasure to work with. Paul walked through the project with us when he did our estimate, and proposed several changes to our designer’s plan that were improved solutions to fix our yard’s drainage challenges. Jessica, the office manager, was always responsive to questions, and Tami did a great job hunting down the plants we selected — which wasn’t that easy in September. When they couldn’t find the specific plants on our plan, she collaborated with us to select acceptable substitutes.
Austin, our project manager, and his crew were wonderful. They are great guys, hard workers, and do an amazing job. Even the installation was a collaborative experience. Austin suggested an additional dry creek bed on the side of the yard to deal with the excess water that funnels into our yard from the neighbor’s driveway. We are looking forward to working with Legacy again next year when we install the next phase of our landscape plan!

resp.text:
Carol, you were such a pleasure to work with and everyone agreed that your design was just beautiful!
We can't wait to see what the next phase has in store.  Thank you again.

name: Dana Williams
text: I had drainage work done and these guys did great. Paul and his crew got on the work quickly and worked hard to complete the job through some very difficult conditions. Austin ran the crew and he was an expert at his work and went well beyond to finish a french drain, grading and downspout pipes to the street. Austin is a fine person to work with as well as his second in charge Abraham.

resp.text: Dana, thank you so very much for the encouraging words!  You are right, sometimes the wet weather makes drainage work rather challenging.  You were both so very patient and helpful during the whole process and we are so very thankful for the opportunity to help you with your drainage issues.

name: Joey Borders
text: If you need landscaping done give Legacy a call. They do all kinds of work, but we personally had hardscaping done. They came out, viewed our patio, designed a new layout, tweaked it a few times to get it within our budget, and completed the work. I even reached out to several other companies in the beginning stages. Legacy gave us the best design with the best cost. We worked with David the majority of the time. He and the company are professional. Extremely courteous and will answer any questions/concerns. Two thumbs up.

resp.text: Joey,  We absolutely loved your design, it was unique and functional for your family.  You were such a pleasure to work with and we appreciate the opportunity to help you with your hardscape project.  Have a great spring!

name: Diane Moore

name: Wes G Smith
text: I would not use this contractor again, nor would I recommend them to anyone else.  They did a drainage project for me where I explicitly described the design I wanted and it incorporated solid PVC pipe.  On the day of the job, the workers showed up with corrugated pipe.  When I called the owner, he stated that PVC would be $800 more, so feeling like I didn't want to start over with another contractor, I told him to go ahead.  Then I found out that a portion of the water to be drained to the street running from the downspout  was going through perforated corrugated pipe (pipe with holes).  They assured me that the water would be moving and would not leak out into already saturated ground (yeah, right).  Then I came home to find that the grate to catch water coming off the sidewalk was about 1 and a half to 2 inches away from the sidewalk, requiring the water to run over dirt before entering the grate.  The owner tried to tell me that it would be no problem and the bare dirt would not erode despite water constantly running over it.  I insisted that concrete be put between the sidewalk and grate to keep the water from washing out the dirt.  When I came home, I found they had used a type of caulk between the grate and the sidewalk, and had done a messy job of it, I don't know if that much caulk will ever cure.  After two days it is still soft.  Additionally, where they cut through the curb, the re-concreting was extremely poorly done.  It looked like they didn't even use a trowel, much less a curbing tool.  It looked like they basically packed the concrete on with their fingers and left it.  Part of the contract called for doing a brick border along the sidewalk.  After I paid them for the portion of the contract for the drainage, they informed me that they were waking away from the contract and that I needed to find someone else to do the edging.  The pity is, the subcontractor they had lined up to do the masonry work actually sounded very competent.  Bottom line, this is a company that, in my opinion, cut corners at every opportunity, poorly designed the project, provided shoddy workmanship, and then walked away with nearly half of the contracted work unperformed.

name: matt demuro
text:
This company gave me probably the worst experience that I have had with a company that has done work for me. I contracted with them to do drainage work, a sprinkler system and landscape lighting.

I was told this would take 3 weeks to complete, with each phase occurring on consecutive weeks. The project as a whole took almost 12 weeks to complete, and this was only because I hounded them with calls multiple times per week.

The drainage work was the first part, it seemed to be fine, though the French drain was not placed the complete length that was discussed originally. Also the fingers of river rich were put in to stop erosion, but almost no grass seed was put in afterwards, so nothing but weeds grew in between the river rock.

The second piece was the sprinkler system. This was put in during a day, but the ground was not backfilled properly and they needed to come back out to fix it. We were told that they would put down grass seed after the lighting job was completed. The lighting work was not completed for another 8 weeks, and there wasn’t any seed put down afterwards. They were also supposed to aerate and oversees the lawn, but since they could not get their mower into our backyard, they told us they would come back with a smaller mower to pull the aerator later. This never happened.

I had to call them 2-3 times a week for 8 weeks to get them to complete the lighting. Part of it was landscape lighting, the other portion was putting in a fan and spotlight in/on our screened patio. The wiring was placed so shallow, that it came out of the ground within a week and they had to come back to fix. The light and fan was supposed to be put in by an electrician, but was just put in by the owner and his friend. They put a cheap conduit over the electrical wire that didn’t even cover the wire.  They sent an electrician out to fix the wiring, but he just rigged another kind of conduit on the bare wire to cover it up.  The uplighting for the trees was sold to us at $65 a light. I just found the lights online for $45 for a 4-pack of lights.

We just gave up with this company and figured we would just be stuck with this work. Over the last year, I kept burying and covering up the wire as it came out of the ground and have been trying to repair the grass in the area where they did sprinkler and drainage work. We are still fighting massive weeds from the lack of follow through on planting grass after their work was completed.

I am writing this review today after I just finished replacing 3 lights that stopped working and half of the wiring that was put in for the landscape lights. Turns out they believe that wire nuts are not necessary and you only need to tape wires together with electrical tape before putting it in the ground.

If you are looking for a company to do landscaping work for you, stay very far away from this company. You will only be sorry if you choose them.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing all of this to our attention.  Unfortunately scheduling can be a challenge when dealing with different elements and sometimes issues arise.  For example the drainage was delayed due to an unmarked water pipe, flooding the drainage trenches.   The ceiling fan was installed by a certified electrician, as was the wiring for the fan, flood lights and outdoor switch.  We would be more than happy to provide the name of the electricians that provided these services.   The contract states that there is a year warranty covering defects in workmanship and materials.   Is regrettable that we did not have the opportunity to fix the issues that you were having with your lights, thus alleviating some of your frustration.  If we had only known of the issues we would have been more than happy to fulfill the contact’s one year warranty.  Again thank you for your comments and we will take them all into consideration to better our services.

name: Mew Thicus
text: These guys are AMAZING. We're just homeowners, not professionals, and called them out to pour a floor for my husband's backyard shop.This is just a delivery service, not a full on concrete laying service. They will only charge for what you use, and usually send the driver with a little extra just in case you've underestimated how much you'll need. Our driver was a few minutes early, was extremely polite and friendly, and even grabbed a shovel to give a quick hand when we (myself and my husband, completely inexperienced with large amounts of concrete before today). He was able to reverse up our horrific driveway, completely missed all of the random junk and cars we had everywhere, and was able to tuck his huge truck right up against the shop. (which in and of itself was very impressive) BE READY BEFORE THEY ARRIVE! By that I mean make sure you have all the tools and equipment you'll need, and have your forms set up. Our driver was extremely patient with us and explained that he's had other customers that had to be charged for extra time. They accept payments with cash, card, and check. Thanks guys! That was an awesome first time experience!

text: Foxcrete was recommended by a neighbor and when we saw the quality of work they did, we didn't bother to look elsewhere. Our patio is more than our greatest expectations! Josh and his crew did an amazing job!

name: Andy Marr
text:
Foxcrete construction was one of the easiest, most professional and downright fastest companies my wife and I have ever worked with, and we have done a Ton of home alterations and improvements.

First of all, Josh is the guy to work with. He is professional, knows his craft, and came out to our house often. We wanted to put in a curved edge patio and he came out and measured the land, staked out the space and figured out what would work best. Our schedules didn't align at first but we made it work once we figured out a workable timeline. He came back a few more times and we discussed color of the concrete, size, dimensions, drainage, and a bunch of other details. He was patient and hear do us out, and you could tell he was excited about the project.

When the crew showed up they were fast, professional, and methodical. They know their craft. They worked from 6am to 7pm some days, going over the details, re-laying sod, cleaning up spills or little messes (nothing major just normal stuff from the construction), and generally just making the backyard look good again.

And the finished product is exactly what we wanted! Josh kept telling us to trust him, he had a plan, he was going to pour some creativity into our project and we wouldn't be disappointed. And he was right! Our once ugly backyard patio space now looks like something out of a magazine! The form is beautiful, it makes our yard flow, and it is just a fantastic job. I HIGHLY recommend these guys. They'll give you what you're looking for and their highlights and creative choices will only improve on your original idea! Great company, great employees, great final product! Thanks guys!

name: David Johnson
text: All the guys were very professional and very happy with the final product. Would highly recommend

name: Bruce Streeter
text:
Foxcrete is highly recommended.
Called for a survey Saturday afternoon expecting a response later in the week. Received a call that same afternoon and had a survey scheduled early into the next week.
Josh was fantastic walking me through all my options and listening to my requirements. Received a quote meeting my specs in short order.
Installation is complete and could not be happier. Everyone on the crew starting with Blake and Scott to each and every helper, were courteous and caring for needs and my yard. They worked quickly and efficiently but most importantly left with me satisfied. My back patio and driveway extension could not have turned out better. The mess was minimal and where there was any issue, it was taken care of before the crew was finished.
I cannot thank Blake and Josh enough for the commitment to excellence they provided on my project.

resp.text: Thanks for allowing us the opportunity to serve you Bruce! This is a fantastic review! We greatly appreciate the time you took to write this! Hope you are enjoying your patio!

name: Warren Wood
text:
Anyone looking for a concrete contracting company should not hesitate to contact Foxcrete Construction Group. They are an exceptional concrete contracting company that most definitely puts the customer first. They went way out of their way to ensure they had a satisfied customer with our project and believe me, we were not an easy customer to please. They had to continuously answer questions and listen to our concerns but did so with nothing but professionalism. They take pride in their work and have been very professional throughout the entire process!

We went with the stamped concrete design with colors to blend well with our brick. We were unsure of the colors and how they would look next to the brick on our house, but with their experience and knowledge they were able to give us what we wanted. The colors are as close to perfect as you can get!

We've never known anyone personally that had a stamped concrete patio or have ever viewed a stamped concrete patio of this design, other than in pictures, so fully understanding the process and the amount of work it takes to build a patio, such as this, was beyond our full comprehension. It takes a lot of work, skill and somewhat of an artistic eye along with exceptional pride to produce a nice product. Foxcrete did just that!

The patio is designed with the appeal of a paver patio, but without stones that will move. The brick lined edge comes down the side walls of the patio giving it a realistic appearance of brick pavers. The colors are a mixture of browns and tans, with the brick edge being a darker color than the inner area of the patio giving it a distinct framed look. We love this design and the colors!

Thank you, Josh and Foxcrete Construction Group, for doing such a fantastic job on this patio! The final product proves that you care and take extreme pride in the work you do!  It's a beautiful patio that I'm sure we will enjoy for many years to come!

text: Called this am for a quote on concrete staining in my 2600 Sq ft home. Husband called back not even an hour later asking if my home was new or existing construction.  I advised existing, and explained to him my wood laminate had been damaged and we just received money from insurance company. He then told me that they are very picky about the jobs they take on and that they don't like to do existing construction because of the damage THEY could cause to cabinets, or walls. He advised me we would be too much trouble.  Kept saying how picky they are with taking on jobs...could it be that we are black and THAT'S the REAL reason?  Why didn't the Wife tell me this initially?  Guess we'll take our 15,000.00 elsewhere. Very bad customer service.

resp.text:
My wife is strictly office only and I handle the estimates. Our company at this time is not set up to do acid stains or dyes on interior Jobs unless they are new construction or remolding jobs. Sincerely Scott Henning

Thank you FOXCRETE DESIGNS! I would highly suggest Foxcrete to anyone looking to get straight forward high quality concrete work.
We knew we wanted stained concrete floors prior to the start of our build however by the time it came to do floors there were SEVERAL issues with the concrete; footprints, broken out concrete, gouge marks, stains from red clay & cedar.  Our builder, Eric Craig Custom Homes (Fantastic builder/excellent experience) hired another company to score & stain the floors.  My husband & I stopped by the house during the scoring process from the first company and immediately stopped work & started brainstorming with our builder about other flooring options.  Eric had Blake from Foxcrete Designs come out & take a look at our "complex concrete job" & give us his professional opinion on the outcome of moving forward with stain/scored.  Blake walked us through the issue spots & his remedies for those areas & gave us his opinion on what the final outcome would look like; nervously we took a chance & so glad we did!  My floors look amazing, truly beautiful!  Blake/Foxcrete are a very professional service that take pride in their work.

text: DON'T CALL MIKE LEWIS!!!! 2 years later and my concrete carport is cracking little by little. Well sure it does but not like what I have.  The man is unbelievably unethical!!

name: brad wethington
text:
Had them extend driveway and rear patio, it looks like a toddler finished the concrete. Very uneven and just shotty work. We also had them stamp a bunch of other concrete and color it. The color has been coming up since they left and can't get them back out here to fix. Also when the dug my yard up for work they left the ground open for two months. Our HOA charged me 50.00 a day it wasn't done. So I paid 8,000.00 to Mike Lewis and 2,800.00 to the HOA. Mike offered no discount and yelled, screamed and cursed at me when I approached him with the charges that I had incurred during his long delay of getting my yard done. Not to mention all the times I had to pay for carpet cleaning because dogs constantly brought mud and sand in from yard. Absolutely terrible experience.

Update: My last two conversations with Mike were him cussing me out using the F bomb at me frequently. Our concrete is cracking terribly after less than a year and colouring is chipping out everywhere. I'm now going to have to have someone else repair and I guess try small claims court to get reimbursed from Mike. I have given him every opportunity to fix this issue and he just yells and makes me the bad guy because I said negative things about the work. I am the one out around $9,000.00 and I will be out even more after paying someone else to fix. Save yourself the hassle and hire someone else. If anyone else that has been screwed by this guy would like to discuss teaming up in court please let me know. People shouldn't be able to take your money and run the way he has. He GUARANTEED any issues I had would be fixed the day he was handed the money.

Note for Mike: If you would fix my issues I will remove all negative comments from here. But until then I will keep informing your potential clients to avoid the worries of dealing with you. I also have our last two conversations recorded to prove I am telling the truth.  Just reach out to me and make this right. That is all I'm asking for.

name: Dana Manganaris
text: BUYER BEWARE! First, the fact that the owner, Butch Emmons,  left his own company 5 stars should tell you something. These are tips to avoid what we went through. 1) clarify the warranty. 2) expect delays 3) make sure the price you discuss is the same cost on the written contract 4) according to a second opinion, the chipping and cracking is NOT normal and be sure the delays in repairs adjust your warranty. 5) yes, Carey is very nice and the minute we had problems, he says “I turned it over to the owner so call him”.  I agree with the other 1 star reviews. This was way too much money to have a very unprofessional job. Good luck.

text: Carey was very attentive and we enjoyed working with him planning our new two level patio. Once Dusten and his crew began the job they were very prompt (on time every day, working a full day) and completed the work over a two week span; the crew was extremely professional and polite and took great care in their work. We are very happy with the finished product and enjoyed meeting Butch, the owner, when he visited the site at the completion of the job.

name: Sea _Lemons34
text:
I called to get a quote from Decorative Concrete Inc. I notified the man of my budget of $2,500 to $3,000; he didn't even want to talk to me after that. I was trying to get a 23x25 foot patio done and a walkway.

I was looking for about 700sqft of concrete to be poured. Which is about 25 cubic yards. A typical install for concrete materials and installations is about $126 (on the high end) per cubic yard. Which would have been in my budget.

If you are dealing with this company, save yourself the time and personal respect; and just do the job yourself or call someone else who is willing to work with everyone.

name: Mitzi Schrimsher
text: Within two weeks of application, the product Decorative Concrete used was cracking and peeling. It took numerous phone calls to the owner and his sales representative, but eventually Butch Emmons, the owner, agreed to redo the work in one area.  In the process, his workers used a harsh chemical and killed our grass, although we had been assured that would not happen. After only two months, we had peeling and cracking in the other areas of our porch and patio. The company admitted their poor work and refunded us, which we appreciate.  However, we now must hire another company to strip the work done by Decorative Concrete and start over. We also have to re-sod a portion of our yard.  In looking at reviews, please be aware that many of the five-star positive comments on this and other sites are from family members of the owner or his sales representative. In hindsight, we should have paid more attention to the one-star reviews, as they more adequately reflect our experience with Decorative Concrete.

name: Eva Ingerson
text: We are very happy with our patio. It is even more than we hoped for. The surface is stunning and very soft on bare feet. The slope is perfect so the water run-off is away from the house. As with most quality businesses, there was a backlog. We started from bare ground, so there were several stages of work to be ordered. If we were just resurfacing an existing slab, I’m sure it would’ve been much faster. From the time we signed our contract until the work began was probably 2 months. And 4 months until it was totally complete. But we couldn’t be happier. Cary was very easy to work with and never gave us false expectations about the timing. He walked us through every major decision to be sure we were satisfied. We asked for a few extras and they accommodated our wishes. I did have to double-check a few measurements and they made the adjustments with no issues. If I could figure out how to post a photo, I would attach it to this review.

text: So to start off with there is absolutely no quality control or quality assurance with this company. On the last day the workers knocked on my door and said hey we are done, I need to get the check.  The manager of the owner never came out to verify the work, until after I talked to the owner.  So he comes out and is able to see exactly where all the messes up parts are, his comment "we will be back in a couple weeks to fix it".  totally laughable, it has now been 4 weeks and of course have not heard a word.  I was in a hurry and went with this company, please avoid them at all costs.  They are way over costs compared to competitors, and they have ZERO management!!

text: Don Kennedy and Sons repaired the Lintel over my garage door. The lintel was sagging from the weight of the brick above the garage door. They installed a system they call 'Lintel Lift'. This was the best solution I found for a PERMANENT and good looking repair. It was also approved by my 2-10 Warranty company. Their installation team did the installation in less than a day and it looks perfect. They were professional and left my property in a clean state. I highly recommend them for this permanent solution for a sagging lintel.

name: Dr. Mitch Robertson
text: I contacted Kennedy and Sons regarding structural issues caused by water damaged. Kennedy and Sons immediately contacted me and scheduled and appointment to assess the damage and to estimate the cost to make repairs.. After Terry Kennedy assessed the damage, he wrote a detailed estimate of the cost of repairs for me to submit to my insurance company. He met with the insurance company's adjuster, at their request, to answer their questions regarding the work to be completed. Terry Kennedy was in close contact during the process of insurance approval and the structural work. I would highly recommend Kennedy and Sons.

name: Hannah
text: Josh and Kyle at Don Kennedy and Sons and their team did an installation of a foundation pier system and exterior drain tile system to reinforce the exterior of our home against further settling and damage and move water away from that area. The whole team was very efficient and extremely hard working. We had to adjust the plan a bit as digging revealed issues that could not have been foreseen, the whole team was flexible and rolled with the punches to get the installation completed and make sure it would function well in the long term. We would certainly call them again if we needed their services in the future.

name: Heather Woodard
text: Was very impressed with the professionalism and help that Ian provided me with over the phone. I felt like an appreciated customer and will definitely continue to do business with this company!

text: We were very pleased with the quality of the foundation repair and lintel lift service.  The entire team - Tim, Adam, Kyle, Diego and Alex - were very professional and pleasant!  We highly recommend Don Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions.

text: Ian was super helpful and friendly. He was able to answer all my questions and help me figure out a solution to my problem. Highly recommend Fon Kennedy and Sons!

name: Tim Knox
text: As a residential real estate agent my clients are faced with structural issues all the time. There is one company that I call and that is Kennedy & Sons. They are responsive, professional, and I can always count on them to be honest and reliable. When I show my clients a report with the Kennedy & Sons name on it they know they've been served by the best and can rely on the results. I highly recommend Jeff and his team for any structural issues your home may have.

name: Dakota Hancock
text: Great price, great people, and great work all around.

text: Kennedy and Sons performed foundation work on my home 15 years ago and did a terrific job. In the process of selling my home the inspector recommended an analysis by a structural engineer. I called Kennedy and Sons and, at no charge and within 48 hours, they sent Grant Collins to assess my home. Grant was very professional, courteous and clearly competent. text: Just wanted to pass on huge kudos to your representative Grant who came out to a house we are looking to buy yesterday.  What a professional and what a nice guy!  He really put us in our comfort zone by telling us the house - basement and crawlspace - was in great shape, tight, no issues.  He did not try to sell us on things we do not need - very hard to find these days!  Grant is an honest and professional broker who WELL represents your company.  He gained you a future client yesterday as we will be back on other properties as we are real estate investors!

name: Tim Lewis
text: Don Kennedy and Sons has worked on my house twice.  The first time it was to correct a foundation "repair" that was botched by another company who would not cover their work.  Kennedy and Sons excavated the old work and tied the piers and our foundation to deep rocks in the mountain, and that part of our house has been solid ever since.  Unfortunately, a different corner of our house needed repair a couple years later, and I called Kennedy and Sons again.  They put in push piers and again tied the foundation to deep rocks.  It remains to be seen how this new work will stand the test of time, but based on the prior work, I'm confident that it will.  The price on the work was very good, and they got to it quickly and were done within a week.  They didn't mess up my property.  When they left, it was surprising to me how well they covered their work, given the amount of digging they'd done.

name: Drew Helveston
text: My wife and I are selling our house and we wanted to see if there were any issues with the foundation.  A friend referred us to Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions.  My wife called to make an appointment.  They were able to come out the following day which was amazing.  The technician who came out to our house was Grant Collins.  He arrived on time and was a joy to work with.  He took time to listen to our needs, questions, and thoughts.  After he was able to inspect the house, he met back with me and discussed his thoughts regarding our house.  He had his report emailed by the following day.   So to sum it up.  Within three days, we were able to get in touch with a expert who looked over our house, answered our questions, and sent us an emailed report.   Grant is the man and someone we would (and will) definitely recommend.

name: William McNeese
text:
Don Kennedy and Sons just completed major structural repairs on a home in preparation for a home’s appraisal and inspection for closing. The work involved Foundation Support Piers under brick footings to fix cracks in brick veneer and Stable Lift Piers with 2x8 girders in the crawlspace to fix sagging floors.

Tony was referred to me by my real estate agent and he was absolutely fantastic. Tony came right on time when he said he would be there and his communications were prompt and professional. It was a pleasure to work with Tony during the proposal phase and the work itself. He is technically knowledgeable and dependable. I highly recommend him! He is the reason I contracted with Don Kennedy & Sons.

The foundation support piers did exactly what they were supposed to do. The stair step cracks in the brick closed right up as we had hoped. There was a little more impact to the yard and soil than I had expected, but not a major issue.

The Stable Lift Piers and 2x8 girders also did their job. They are not as elaborate of a solution as the adjustable “Smart Jacks” on top of poured concrete pads from AFS, but they do work and they are a little less expensive. I recommend that consumers understand what they are purchasing on major repairs like this and get someone to help if they don’t. I did an internship with a home inspector, and I have structural improvements at my main residence, so I was able to spot some minor issues which Tony readily and proactively agreed to correct once I explained them on the phone. The laborers came right over, understood my concerns, and fixed them right away. Some additional materials were added at no expense/no questions. I think if Tony had been available to inspect before I did he would have corrected these on his own. My own inspection was prematurely hurried by the office manager – see below.

Administratively this business has some improvements to make. At 2:00 on Friday I was called by the administrative assistant that my work was complete and asking for immediate payment. I kindly asked for a chance to see the work first over the weekend and that I would pay on my way to work first thing Monday morning. I was told that they would have to ask the office mgr. This made sense and I agreed. Surprisingly, Jordan called me back promptly explaining that this was not acceptable per her manager and that I needed to leave my own job and arrange for payment with Jordan ASAP. I immediately left a voice mail for Tony. Thankfully he straightened it all out. I was never given an apology by the office manager.

So, I ran over first thing Saturday morning to inspect and observed the minor corrections needed to be made. The office mgr’s insistence on paying right after they were done Friday seemed underhanded (and downright strange too), but Tony made it all right. The office manager needs to get better at being reasonable conducting business, treating people respectfully, and resolving business issues firsthand with customers. However, administrative assistant Jordan worked very hard to provide great, positive customer service. I remained with the laborers on Saturday to make sure everything was fixed to spec, and it was. The laborers worked hard and were very friendly.

I’d recommend to Don Kennedy and to their customers that a 7-10 business day payment period be part of the contract to allow the customer time to inspect repairs, Tony to inspect, and/or get a buddy to inspect after completion of the work. This will also take a lot of stress off the payment-hungry front office and the customer. I’ve contracted lots of work over the years and I’ve never been pressed for payment so urgently – despite a 50% down payment before starting the work.

In summary I do recommend Don Kennedy & Sons for residential structural repairs and especially if you work with Tony.

name: Eduard Boeckmann
text: Don's crew came out to my house and did exactly the work that i asked for and more. They did a great job!

name: Claire Roth
text:
I would not use them again and will continually tell friends and family about the headache we went through for over a week.

The construction workers are great; however, the owner and crew manager are extremely disorganized. We started calling Wednesday over a potentially huge concern. We finally halted work Monday afternoon since Todd and Jeff were not getting back to us or addressing concerns in a timely manner. Jeff's schedule miraculously cleared up to come address our concerns the very next morning--almost an entire week after first calling!

Overall, my main take away is the lack of communication, especially when spending so much money on foundation work. Our problem was misdiagnosed and we ended up owing more than the estimate as well.

I was shocked because I had heard good things and they were even suggested by our realtor. Needless to say, we're going elsewhere for additional work.

Hello Clair
Thanks for expressing your frustration working with my company.  It is too bad you feel the need to "continually tell friends and family" about this experience but that is certainly your right to do so.
As I discussed with your husband we certainly want to ensure that every customer we serve has a great experience.

I can not do anything to help you by posting on the internet, however,  if we can help you at all please call me directly at (256) 533-1100 and I will do anything I can to help you.

text:
March of this year we hired MDH Construction to do a foundation repair job of one of our homes. With genuine sincerity we would rate this company,  under the leadership of its owner, Mike Hayes, as "Best in Class". The group is made up of dedicated professionals and highly skilled individual driven by high quality service comittment.
The repair MDH was hired to do was one that had been previously attempted by another foundation repair company. This was our second time addressing the same problem. While the first company ensured us the fix we paid for was permanent. It was short number of years later that we began seeing signs indicating the repair was failing . We found ourselves back at square one.
At the time we did not know MDH Foundation. We did reach out to the only other company we knew of thru advertisement only, and while we had someone come out assess and quote us a price, we chose to hold off. Very impressive sales presentation they did but we were just not convinced on their proposed corrective plan.  Some time later we hear of MDH, and a lot of good things being said of the owner, Mike Hayes. Not only on their foundation repair work, but as a very highly respectable contractor too.  Earlier this year we met with a member of the MDH team, and an assessment was made. Then before the job plan was finalized, the owner, Mike, came out to thoroughly go over the plan. It was the first time we felt really comfortable about the corrective plan.  Mike has a great group of professionals and skill guys that communicate well together. They were very attentive to our concerns, explained and answered every question.  They were punctual and respective of time. Always leaving area neat after each day.  We only wish we would have found MDH Foundation Repair the first time around.

name: kentgremmels
text: In 2014 I contracted with QCL to put in an irrigation system, landscape and build a water feature in my back yard.  The irrigation system and the landscape was adequate but the waterfall/pond was totally unacceptable.  The job foreman, Stephen, had used flat rock (flagstone?) throughout the fall and there was no structure to it at all.  The stone was just laid flat and the water ran over it like it was concrete and it leaked terribly.  Several discussions with Stephen and nothing was done.  I then called his supervisor and someone named Brandon came out to look at it.  When he saw it he was surprised.  I asked him if he would have this in his backyard and he said no.  He tore apart the fall and pond and found several leaks where the liner had been glued together. I found out later that a pond that small should not have a seam and should be one piece.  I will admit, I liked the way the falls and pond looked.  Brandon added structure and the water flowed down the rocks like a waterfall.  I thought it was all over but within a week the water level was down considerably.  Brandon kept saying it was evaporation.  I went online and found a leak test so I did it.  I shut off the pump and covered the pond to prevent evaporation.  It still leaked.  Brandon conducted his own tests and determined that the water was flowing over the top of the liner in several places.  His remedy was to loosen all the fittings to presumably decrease the flow of water.  Now when you turn the pump off, the backflow valve was rendered useless and the water would leak out of the pipes and go into the overflow drain.  His solution to this problem was to tape the overflow drain shut so the water wouldn't go into the overflow.  Again, I referred to the internet and this is not a proper solution to the problems.  QCL has been to my house 25 or more times to fix the problem and I still have a leaking waterfall/pond.  QLC now says that I stepped on rocks and punctured the liner and broke a pipe.  They also said I waited  2 years before I complained about a problem.  I did not step on the rocks and puncture the liner and the only people to move rocks around to break a pipe was them and my first complaint was immediately following  the installation and has been  continuous since then.  QLC now says they cannot warranty a pond for 5 years.  The problem is, there has not been one season that I didn't have problems.  I suggested that I hire an independent contractor to remove the old pond and put in a new pond.  If the new contractor determined it was not a faulty installation, I would pay for all the repairs.  If, however, it was due to the installation, QCL would have to pay the cost of the installation or refund my payment of $6100.00.  They refused.  I know this was long, but I feel it is very important that you read and understand what happened.  The only thing I did wrong was I was too patient and gave them the benefit of the doubt and the chance to fix the problem.  I would not do business with Quality Creative Landscaping.

text:
The contractor built a 2 room block structure into the hill on the side of the house to be used as a storm shelter and store room with a 16 X 27 parking pad on top.  He also built three split block retaining walls to control the hillside.
The room and retaining walls seemed to be well built but after the first rain we found the walls of the room had not been properly waterproofed and water would seep through the walls and pool on the floor.  After this rain one of the retaining walls started to sink down.  I contacted the contractor and after a few weeks he came back and took the wall down and rebuilt it.  Unfortunately, he did not do anything to improve the wall so the next time it rained the wall started to sag again.  Then the other two retaining walls started to sink.
From 12/12/13 until 1/14/14 I tried to get the contractor to come back to discuss the problems but after 1/14/14 he stopped answering my calls and texts.
I finally had to hire another contractor to repair the retaining walls and he found that the walls had not been built to the manufactures specifications.

name: Betty Pierce
text:
Some years ago we needed some significant waterproofing and structural repairs done in our basement home. We contacted a few different companies to provide an Inspection and estimate. After some discussion we decided
On a company that was not on the higher side of the estimates. We felt like the fix would be pretty much the same no matter who we chose
And saving money was in our interest at the time..One company we called was a fairly well known local company A.F.S. We were familiar with them because they began here in Decatur
So we would see trucks around town. FYI,  I wanted you to know, we should’ve called AFS from the start. Today I’m here some 7 odd years later, after spending thousands of dollars with the low price alternative and my
Sump pump and drainage system doesn’t work, our walls are blistering and cracking up, down and horizontally, water is seeping thru the wall cracks and the concrete blocks are shifting and cracking our exterior brick and interior block walls. I have limited mobility and couldn’t go check on these things easily and things kept getting worse. Considering what we received from the lower priced company, we decided to call AFS to provide their opinion on our basement situation. At this point , the only thing working or effective was a dehumidifier. It was time to seek experts advice. We had previously used AFS in a limited capacity for our cracked pool deck and they performed that repair just fine and although that repair is not inexpensive,
It was much less and more quickly usable than any other options we looked at. So from there we felt we could allow them a chance to tell us (what )was happening and (why )was it happening . When the day came for the inspection, David Flamm , the inspector called our home in advance and let us know his arrival time and asked if we could sit for a few questions before beginning the inspection. He felt we would have something of value to help  determine the cause of the damage. We felt he was sincere and listened to what we had to say and even wrote down the answers. We watched as he went room to room with his big light and something like a laser . He was very thorough, and  took  pictures as he moved around the house.
One thing he did,  that most never do, is David removed his boots before walking on my clean floors. Not a big thing but it got my attention.
After the inspection inside , he explained what he would be doing outside and that my husband
Was welcome to tag along if he wanted, so he did. He was rather impressed with David’s knowledge and ability to explain the plan of repair. After our experience with another company (who did almost nothing) and David’s attitude and attention to our concerns, we were very relieved that we called AFS. He took pictures and put them on his laptop for us to clearly see the issues, he asked our opinion and waited for our response. Never did he act pushy or lacked any uncertainty about what he would do to help us. He allowed us to view video software of the repairs needed, and even priced the project as he went thru the videos. Needless to say,  we were very comfortable with Dave and could feel he really knew what the problems required. Before we had to ask, David explained AFS Warranty, Service and maintenance program and how they return and maintain the eguipment so we didn't have to worry. This was very helpful considering my physical limitations and my husband is very busy with work. We felt very reassured after spending a couple of hours with David Flamm, we had called the right company. AFS must invest a lot of time into the people that work for them, it was so smooth . We had no trouble connecting the dots. David explained the project review process they go they prior to arriving to our home and how the foreman on the job has already seen the project and all of the pictures as David and the foreman discuss the ins and outs of it. It seems every concern we had initially was addressed before we had to express it. AFS, should be the first and only call you make for your home today.
We are glad we did.

resp.text: Hello Betty! Thank you for taking time to submit a review about your experience with our company. We appreciate your thoughtful, detailed account of how we were able to deliver great results. We take tremendous care to provide the highest level of service possible during every project—and it’s awesome to be recognized for our efforts. - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

name: Patricia Flory
text:
Nathan, Garrett and Alfonso showed up at the scheduled time to begin 5 days of work to install French drains, a sump pump and dehumidifier along with a full basement crawl space encapsulation at my house. They were very prompt and courteous.  We had a small problem that Nathan brought to my attention after he and his crew started the prep work in the area which resulted in them having to remove 2 additional (early 1930's) brick support columns and level the dirt foundation under them.  Had Nathan not brought the potential problem to my attention, even with the work they were doing, I might have had more collapse in that area in the future.  Now I won't have any concerns about that.  I was very impressed with how well these 3 men worked together and also independently while completing the job.  AFS has turned an old damp 1930's basement crawl space area into a bright, clean space my grandkids could play in at my house.  The crew cleanup in my yard was spot-on.  They even hauled off those brick columns for me.  I'm looking forward to the follow-up visit in about two months to see how much more lift they can get in my (had been) sagging floors.  There was some immediate improvement when they tightened all the floor jacks and after that new dehumidifier dries up my floor rafters for a few weeks we should see even more improvement.  No more squeaky, rattling floors!!
Thank you, AFS.
Patricia

resp.text: Ms. Flory, wow, thank you for such a thorough and kind review! We are glad you are happy with the work completed on your floors and crawl space as well! Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Patricia Blackman
text: My older home is on a crawl space that had become damp -- a real mess -- and I feared the foundation might have problems.  Ben Worsham inspected the crawl space and reassured me that the foundation itself was sound.  But he did find a leaking pipe and water damage to the subfloor.  He explained those issues, providing photos of the damage for me to submit to my insurance and to provide to the plumber and the restoration company that I called to fix those problems.  He was professional, thorough, helpful and responsive to my questions.  Later, the crawl space was sprayed with a cleaning/anti-mold agent and encapsulated efficiently by Josh Brazile and his crew (Victor C. and Rafael V.), who kept me posted on their progress and patiently answered my questions.  I recommend AFS!

name: Tom Counts
text:
I had a problem with the 20 year old concrete in my carport settling and cracking. It had to be stabilized or I was going to have to totally redo the carport.  I did not know who to contact but a friend had AFS do some foundation stabilization work for him. I asked him about AFS.  I had seen the TV ads but know that anyone can do a slick tv commercial.  It turns out, the friend was positively impressed with AFS on his project. So, I made an appointment for their rep to visit.  I was still a little skeptical.  The field rep arrived on time and looked at my issue.  He suggested their concrete stabilization product.  He described how it would work and be installed.  He was not at all pushy nor did he give me any slick sales pitch.  He knew about the product, how it was installed and what it could do.  I agreed to do the project with them and made a down payment on the project.  We scheduled the job and on the agreed upon day, the installation crew arrived.  They were a little later than initially planned BUT the office called to say they were running behind, so that was not an issue.  They were maybe 30 minutes later than planned. The installation guys checked over the carport and talked over their plans with me. Then they went straight to work. They were clean cut, totally nice people to have at my home with no smoking or foul language - just hard work! There was an obvious difference to the carport when they were through.  So, I really felt good about their work.  They also cleaned up any mess that they made (a little concrete dust) with the tools they brought to the job site. Prior to this experience, I did not know this company,  other than my from friends recommendation & a TV commercial.  After my experience I would not hesitate to recommend them.
I give AFS an A+ & 5 stars!

resp.text: Mr. Counts, thank you for such a thorough review and recommendation! We are glad you had a pleasant experience and that the repair to your carport was installed to your satisfaction. Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: M Otto
text:
What a group of people and company!  I had a huge problem in my basement/crawlspace. Over the last 2 years, it has flooded during the heavy rains in January and February.  I did some research to evaluate this issue and decided to go with a reputable, established, and known company.  I was not disappointed.  Mr. David Flamm arrived at my house promptly for my initial appointment.  He was professional and personable.  After a few minutes of discussion, he understood my concerns and started his investigation.  Once he completed his investigation, he sat down my wife and I and went over his findings. His presentation of what could be done was easy to understand and follow along using the video clips on his computer. All seemed logical, but me, being the ever skeptic, asked many questions about how the system would work and why it seemed the water was infiltrating my living spaces after 7 years of no water. He answered all of my questions and his explanations made sense.  After it was all said and done, we had the Aquastop Control groundwater seepage system with Aquastop basement air system,  EZflow  tubing with the triple pump action installed.
Day of installation:
The team showed up on time for the install lead by Nick.  It had been raining a lot AGAIN and i had my makeshift sump-pump system running to dewater the area where it was building up.  The team laid down plastic tarp so as to not get my finished basement dirty and commenced to working.  It took them 2 days to complete.  What a job. When they laid in the pump system and started the pumps, the water buildup that i had my makeshift system in for, drained and did not come back.  EUREKA!!  Since this system has been in place, we continue to get the storms and flooding but my basement/crawlspace remain dry.  The system works as described and projected.  I cannot thank Dave and his team from AFS enough.  Their professionalism and concern to provide a solution to my problem was genuine and their work is top of the line. Dave's evaluation of my needs and his concern to present me with different options was genuine and without company profit in mind. I highly recommend this company and team for any issues you may have in basement or crawlspace area.  One happy customer...Mike Otto

resp.text: Mr. Otto, we are indeed pleased to hear that you are a happy customer! And, wow, thank you for sharing this with us. We are glad you had a great experience with Dave and that your basement/crawl space is dry now! Let us know if we can assist further - we'd be happy to.

name: Jeff Simmons
text:
I had mold and water seeping through my concrete block wall in basement. Due to hydrostatic pressure my walls were caving in slightly. I don’t remember the terminology  AFS uses but they came in and put what looks like a tarp over the walls.  It’s to prevent moisture and mold buildup. Life time warranty. It might be working but since my walls are covered up I am only guessing it is. After I removed everything from the walls in the basement, yes, everything, including taking out my bathroom, they jackhammered around the edge of the walls about a one foot trench. AFS then put in place , what I call a gutter. Rocks were placed around this gutter along with a moisture barrier and then concrete poured on top. Supposedly, they put holes into each concrete block on my wall and place  a pipe that goes from block to gutter. As you know, these blocks have cylinders inside where water can build up. The purpose is for water to drain from block(my wall)into the gutter then it’s to flow to corner of house where there is a sump pump.

Short story is that it’s been two years and no water has touched the sump pump. As you know the last two years have been like northwest Washington where we are getting tons of rain. Now I’m having moisture, called efflorescence, coming up where they jackhammered. AFS came by several times and put a sealer on floor. Never worked. Had another man come by and look at system to see if water was flowing properly; it was. I spoke to one of the managers and he stated there was nothing else they could do. I thought about legal action but statue of limitations had expired. $13k pretty much wasted and I’m left still trying to fix the problem.

resp.text:
Mr. Simmons,

We are sorry for your  frustration.  Making sure there is no confusion or frustration with any of our customers is vitally important to us.  We have a full time Service Department and Customer Care Club that serves no other purpose than to take care of our existing customers which you referenced with our previous visits to your home. That is something we put a lot of focus on.  If we miss you then please call us back but do look out for our call so that we can address your concern.
